description: Formed from the Latin suffix -ana; compare ism (from -ism), itis (from -itis), phobia (from -phobia).

entries.meaning: A collection of things associated with a person or place, especially a personal collection of anecdotes or conversations at table
examples: The FRENCH ANAS, or Selections from the best of the French Anas, interspersed with biographical sketches. In three elegant Volumes, small 8vo. price 15s. boards

entries.meaning: (in prescriptions) Of each; an equal quantity.
examples:
wine and honey, ana [or contracted to aa] / ij
of wine and honey, each, two ounces

description: Clipping of anorexia; intentionally formed to resemble the given name Ana as form of personification and coded language. Compare mia.

entries.meaning: (Internet, slang) Anorexia (used especially by the pro-ana movement).

adverbs.description: ana (comparative more ana, superlative most ana)

entries.meaning: In a direction analogous to up, but along the additional axis added by the fourth dimension.
examples: Your right half would move ana, let us say, and your left half would move kata. The two halves would, in their parallel spaces, move past the plane of rotation, and then they would swing back into our space.

entries.meaning: Alternative form of anna: a former subdivision of the rupee.
